method.name: Intuitionistic Fuzzy Sets K-Nearest Neighbors classifier

reference.ref: S. Hadjitodorov, An intuitionistic fuzzy sets application to the k-nn method, Notes on Intuitionistic Fuzzy Sets, vol. 1, pp. 66-69, 1995.

generalDescription.howWork: In the IFSKNN algorithm, two values (membership and nonmembership) are computed for each instance. The membership is obtained as the distance to the mean of the class, whereas the nonmembership is computed as the distance to the nearest mean of the rest of the classes. The classification is completed using the membership and nonmembership to modify the distances computed by a k-NN classifier.

parameterSpec.param: K value: K parameter in the k-NN rule.

method.example:
Problem type: Classification Method: IFSKNN-C Dataset: appendicitis Test Show results: Vis-Clas-Check Parameters: Default settings
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the Vis-Clas-Check results' file the classification results for the test set:
TEST RESULTS ============ Classifier= appendicitis Fold 0 : CORRECT=0.8181818181818181 N/C=0.0 Fold 1 : CORRECT=0.8181818181818181 N/C=0.0 Fold 2 : CORRECT=0.8181818181818181 N/C=0.0 Fold 3 : CORRECT=0.8181818181818181 N/C=0.0 Fold 4 : CORRECT=1.0 N/C=0.0 Fold 5 : CORRECT=0.7272727272727273 N/C=0.0 Fold 6 : CORRECT=0.9 N/C=0.0 Fold 7 : CORRECT=0.8 N/C=0.0 Fold 8 : CORRECT=0.8 N/C=0.0 Fold 9 : CORRECT=1.0 N/C=0.0 Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.15 stddev Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.08462361978072903 Correctly classified: 0.85 Global N/C: 0.0
